reviews.text: Attended the CIO conference over a two day period. Good conference facilities in terms of rooms & locations throughout the hotel.Food was ok for such a large group. Hotel room was very substantial for just one, made a nice change! Not sure I would want to stay here under my own steam, but for business trip / conference very good & the staff I met were polite & friendly.
reviews.title: Good venue for conference /stay

reviews.text: Excellent stay. Cannot fault, very clean, spacious rooms and great food. Kept getting lost down the corridors as hotel so big. Facilities were great, all went for a swim before the evening started!! Entertainment night was fantastic, all my girls enjoyed it!! Would definitely do it again :-)
reviews.title: Ladies night/Hen do

reviews.text: Great night, the food was excellent , the entertainment was interesting and funny ! Our room was beautiful , we upgraded and it was well worth the supplement . Breakfast was really excellent too with all the normal choices .The staff that we came in touch were very courteous and helpful. My friends enjoyed the pool and sauna etc in the afternoon before I arrived and enjoyed them and said it wasn't too busy and it was a Friday afternoon.if you are looking for a fun hen do or girly night out, this is ideal.
reviews.title: Ladies Night

reviews.text: Stayed 16th March for sooth and stay package - this was my and my mothers first spa experience and went with really high expectation of being treated really special unfortunatly being so busy this was not the case, it felt like being on a conveyer belt and hearing the same sales patter from the beauticians was slightly annoying after the 2rnd treatment, sfter coming out of the treatment having no where to sit and chill out was not the best end to being relaxed, the ice and heat experience could be nice if you did not have to que to get into each room. I expected to be realy relaxed and quiet as was escaping children at home but this was not the case as lots of noise and no where really to chill out.
reviews.title: Not as special as expected

reviews.text: The treatments are lovely but think they are too busy to make it a special which is what many people want to feel and for the amount you pay its not cheap.
reviews.title: Nice location, very efficient staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Exceptional service from all the members of staff. The meals, room and facilities are first rate. Well worth the stay particularly if you pick up one of their offers which we found to be amazing value.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I decided to take-in a relaxing stay at the Whittlebury Hall Spa on Easter Friday before a planned weekend with close family. We both have busy work lives, and were looking forward to some pleasant chilling-out and relaxation. However, our dreams were shattered when we arrived to find the Hotel and Spa was absolutely crammed with people out to take in an evening show with a former X-Factor contestant, and a Take That tribute band. The Spa was unpleasantly over-crowded, and we had a poor night's sleep as the drunken excesses of the revellers spilled into the bedroom corridors until 3am. It's probably a decent venue on the right occasion... but it would have been courteous if we have been informed of these events at the time of booking so that we could (and would) have made alternative arrangements. Overall, poor and impersonal service, a 'cash-first' attitude and very disappointing.
reviews.title: Check if the Hotel is hosting events that might spoil your stay...

reviews.text: jazz was great,meat beautifully cooked but the roast potatoes not so good.Desserts were not to my taste,tradional pudding would have been better with sunday roast.Young staff where very polite but could have done with more training.Not sure if we will go back,but the music was good.
reviews.title: Sunday jazz lunch

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went at Easter and it really was to busy, no seats in the spa or by the pool. Massage was meant to last 25mins both had just 12mins! Hotel was noisy with travellers in the evening until 3am. Not the relaxing stay that was advertised. Room was dated with empty mini bar and no water.
reviews.title: To busy

reviews.text: Food was good as was service in restaurant.
reviews.title: Perfect Hen Night

reviews.text: Visited on 15th March, which as a complementary visit due to there being a problems when we went in January with the ventilation.
reviews.title: There were better times

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the whole, it was better than January, but as I have been going to Whittlebury for a number of years, I can safely say that is is lovely... but going down hill. With all the special offers, the spa is over crowded and there is a element of waiting for all of the things there. The staff are always nice and helpful, the food is always lovely...... Just not as 'special' as it used to be.
reviews.title: A night away from the Teenagers!

reviews.text: Hubby and I took the opportunity of the Daughter having 6 friends to stay the night to have a bit of Us time at Whittlebury Hall. We like WH, we've been before for parties and work, and have used the spa facilities. It's a lovely place in a beautiful location. We stayed one night on a D, B & B basis.
reviews.title: Less pampering more noise reduction!!

reviews.text: We enjoyed pre dinner drinks in the Silverstone Bar and whilst Hubby watched the (appalling) rugby match, I read the papers.
reviews.title: Excellent Break

reviews.text: We had a 3 course dinner in the Astons restaurant. I had melon with a raspberry mousse for my starter and whilst said mousse was really good, the melon was dry and tasteless. Shoudn't have had it on the plate! My brisket however was delicious, wish I could have eaten more of it. Hubby really enjoyed his steak.
reviews.title: Make sure you have in writing before atrival when your usage of the spa finishes

reviews.text: Me and my boyfriend stated overnight midweek on the escape and spa stay package. We had been before on this package do we were really looking forward to going again and we were not disappointed. Check in was fast and our room was ready upon arrival so we went to our room first to unpack before going to the spa. The room was clean and very spacious. We had a standard room. We put our valuables in the free safe which was a bonus. We then had our first treatment which was a soothing back & neck massage which was lovely. We then headed to the spa to make full use of the steam rooms and ice cave. It wasn't very busy at as far as we were concerned, but some disgruntled "regulars" were complaining how busy it was for a Wednesday, obviously not used to having to share a steam room or sauna with more than two people. The buffet lunch on our package was held in the Grand Prix suite and was cream of vegetable soup to start, then a choice of beef chilli with rice or a mushroom dish. There were also salads and cold meats on offer. In the evening we had dinner in Astons restaurant which was excellent. We both had the roasted pepper tart to start, then the rump steak for mains which was cooked to perfection. Breakfast the next morning was buffet style and there was a good selection of continental and full English options on offer. The staff were very polite on all occasions we spoke with them. We shall most definitely return again soon.
reviews.title: Lovely, relaxing stay.

reviews.text: Had an overnight break at Whittlebury Hall midweek which we enjoyed as did the friends who were with us. Facilities are excellent but there were a few minor niggles, which didn't detract from our enjoyment, and one that did. Was looking forward to using the jacuzzi but after a couple of minutes we were all forced to leave, eyes stinging from over-chlorination. In addition it started to cause a rash on my arm and leg. Watching over half an hour or so nobody stayed in there for more than a couple of minutes, all leaving whilst rubbing their eyes. From other reviews I can see this has occurred before so it would seem that their control over chorination isn't what it should be. It was dangerously toxic around the jacuzzi in my opinion. Even in the jacuzzi part of the main pool,when the bubbles were switched on, my eyes started to sting after a few minutes. I've never experienced this at any other facility.
reviews.title: Winter Break

reviews.text: Other niggles: the bathroom door was too small for its frame and neither latched nor locked as the latch didn't reach the striker plate; one wall light flickered continually so couldn't be used; the bath plug wasn't attached to the chain. Didn't use the bath so didn't have the hassle of trying to get the plug out; we arranged to have sheets and blankets, as offered, but that didn't happen. Despite these niggles the room was otherwise excellent and comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice one night spa break away

reviews.text: The restaurant: generally excellent though the waitress had a poor grasp of English so it was difficult for her to understand our requirements but she more than made up for it in charm and friendliness. Some starters were a bit small and the soup just warm, not hot. Food was very good though but tending towards meagre portions and no vegetables. Overall we did enjoy it though as they, on request, served up a plate of vegetables for us to share. Shouldn't need to ask though.
reviews.title: Very relaxing weekend with great facilities and gorgeous food

reviews.text: Would we return? Yes as it is still a classy hotel with excellent amenities but it needs to iron out some issues. As things are they need to consider providing a chemical warfare suit for using the jacuzzi.
reviews.title: "Sheer Bliss"
